Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery bowl with flaring base, slightly convex sides and rounded rim, both the interior and exterior are covered with a red-brown slip and spotted with traces of a cream-coloured deposit, with traces of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, now smudged.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393247) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393247)
